content:
HealthInformation HealthInformation Class

In this Article

Edit

Represents common health report information. It is included in all health reports sent to health store and in all health events returned by health queries.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class HealthInformationPublic NotInheritable Class HealthInformation

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
    Object
  • HealthInformation
    HealthInformation

Auto sequence number, replaced with a valid sequence number by the health client.
UnknownSequenceNumber
UnknownSequenceNumber

Unknown sequence number, which is an invalid sequence number that is not accepted by the health store.

Properties summary

Description
Description

Gets or sets the description of the health information. It represents free text used to add human readable information about the report.

Gets the health state of the health information.
Property
Property

Gets the property of the health report.
RemoveWhenExpired
RemoveWhenExpired

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the report is removed from health store when it expires. If set to false, the report is treated as an error when expired. false by default.

SequenceNumber

Gets or sets the sequence number associated with the report. Must be greater than UnknownSequenceNumber.

Gets the source Identifier which identifies the watchdog/system component which generated the health information.

Gets or sets how long the health report is valid. Must be larger than TimeSpan.Zero.

Constructors

  • Edit
    HealthInformation(String, String, HealthState)
    HealthInformation(String, String, HealthState)

    Initializes a new instance of the HealthInformation class.

    public HealthInformation(string sourceId, string property, HealthState healthState)Public Sub New(sourceId As String, property As String, healthState As HealthState)

    Parameters

    • sourceId
      String
      String

      The source of the report. Cannot be null or empty. It can't start with "System.", which is reserved keyword for system components reporting.

    • property
      String
      String

      The property of the report. Cannot be null or empty.

    • healthState
      HealthState
      HealthState

      The health state of the report. Must be specified. Must be one of the Error, Warning or Ok values.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException
      ArgumentNullException

      sourceId cannot be null.

    • ArgumentNullException
      ArgumentNullException

      property cannot be null.

    • ArgumentException
      ArgumentException

      sourceId cannot be empty.

    • ArgumentException
      ArgumentException

      property cannot be empty.

    • ArgumentException
      ArgumentException

      Specified healthState is not supported.

Fields

  • Edit
    AutoSequenceNumber
    AutoSequenceNumber

    Auto sequence number, replaced with a valid sequence number by the health client.

    public const long AutoSequenceNumber = 0LPublic Const AutoSequenceNumber As Long = 0L

    Remarks

    When a health client receives a report with Auto sequence number, it replaces the auto sequence number with a valid sequence number. The sequence number is guaranteed to increase in the same process, even if the client machine time goes backwards.

  • Edit
    UnknownSequenceNumber
    UnknownSequenceNumber

    Unknown sequence number, which is an invalid sequence number that is not accepted by the health store.

    public const long UnknownSequenceNumber = -1LPublic Const UnknownSequenceNumber As Long = -1L

Properties

  • Edit
    Description
    Description

    Gets or sets the description of the health information. It represents free text used to add human readable information about the report.

    public string Description { get; set; }Public Property Description As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

      A String which describes the health information in human readable form.

    Remarks

    The maximum string length for the description is 4096 characters.

  • Edit
    HealthState
    HealthState

    Gets the health state of the health information.

    public HealthState HealthState { get; }Public ReadOnly Property HealthState As HealthState

    Property Value

    • HealthState
      HealthState

      A HealthState representing the reported health state.

    Remarks

    The accepted health states are Ok, Warning and Error.

  • Edit
    Property
    Property

    Gets the property of the health report.

    public string Property { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Property As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

      A String representing the property of the health report. Together with the SourceId, it uniquely identifies the health information.

    Remarks

    The property is a String and not a fixed enumeration to allow the reporter to categorize the health event for a specific property of the entity. For example, reporter A can report the health of the Node01 "storage" property and reporter B can report the health of the Node01 "connectivity" property. In the health store, these reports are treated as separate health events for the Node01 entity.

  • Edit
    RemoveWhenExpired
    RemoveWhenExpired

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the report is removed from health store when it expires. If set to false, the report is treated as an error when expired. false by default.

    public bool RemoveWhenExpired { get; set; }Public Property RemoveWhenExpired As Boolean

    Property Value

    • Boolean
      Boolean

      true if the report should be removed from health store when expired; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    When clients report periodically, they should set RemoveWhenExpired false (default). This way, is the reporter has issues (eg. deadlock) and can't report, the entity is evaluated at error when the health report expires, and this will flag the entity as Error. Periodic health clients should send reports with higher frequency than time to live to account for delays due to health client batching, message transport over the wire and health store processing.

  • Edit
    SequenceNumber
    SequenceNumber

    Gets or sets the sequence number associated with the report. Must be greater than UnknownSequenceNumber.

    public long SequenceNumber { get; set; }Public Property SequenceNumber As Long

    Property Value

    • Int64
      Int64

      An Int64 representing the report sequence number.

    Remarks

    The report sequence number is used by health store to detect stale reports.

    Most of the times, the reporter doesn't need to specify the sequence number. The default value AutoSequenceNumber can be used instead. When a health client receives a report with Auto sequence number, it replaces the auto sequence number with a valid sequence number. The sequence number is guaranteed to increase in the same process, even if the client machine time goes backwards.

  • Edit
    SourceId
    SourceId

    Gets the source Identifier which identifies the watchdog/system component which generated the health information.

    public string SourceId { get; }Public ReadOnly Property SourceId As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

      A String representing the source of the health report.

  • Edit
    TimeToLive
    TimeToLive

    Gets or sets how long the health report is valid. Must be larger than TimeSpan.Zero.

    public TimeSpan TimeToLive { get; set; }Public Property TimeToLive As TimeSpan

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan
      TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan representing the time to live of the health report.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException
      ArgumentException

      The specified value was invalid. Please provide a duration that is larger than 0.

    Remarks

    When clients report periodically, they should send reports with higher frequency than time to live. If clients report on transition, they can set the time to live to infinite.

    When time to live expires, the health event that contains the health information is either removed from health store, if RemoveWhenExpired is true or evaluated at error, if RemoveWhenExpired is false.

  • Edit
    ToString()
    ToString()

    Creates a string description of the health information.

    public override string ToString()Public Overrides Function ToString As String

    Returns

    • String
      String

      String description of the health information.

    Overrides

    Object.ToString()

Assembly

Represents common health report information. 
It is included in all health reports sent to health store and in all health events returned by health queries.
